009package Binary_Regions;
010
011
012import java.util.List;
013
014import ij.IJ;
015import ij.ImagePlus;
016import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import imagingbook.lib.ij.IjUtils;
021import imagingbook.lib.util.Enums;
022import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
023import imagingbook.pub.regions.BreadthFirstLabeling;
024import imagingbook.pub.regions.DepthFirstLabeling;
025import imagingbook.pub.regions.LabelingMethod;
026import imagingbook.pub.regions.RecursiveLabeling;
027import imagingbook.pub.regions.RegionContourLabeling;
028import imagingbook.pub.regions.RegionLabeling;
029import imagingbook.pub.regions.RegionLabeling.BinaryRegion;
030import imagingbook.pub.regions.SequentialLabeling;
031
032/**
033 * This ImageJ plugin is an example for how to use the region
034 * labeling classes in the "regions" package:
035 * {@link BreadthFirstLabeling},
036 * {@link DepthFirstLabeling},
037 * {@link RecursiveLabeling},
038 * {@link RegionContourLabeling},
039 * {@link SequentialLabeling}.
040 * One of four labeling types can be selected (see the {@code run()} method).
041 * All should produce the same results (except {@link RegionContourLabeling},
042 * which may run out of memory easily).
043 * Requires a binary (segmented) image.
044 * 
045 * @author WB
046 * @version 2020/12/17
047 * 
048 */
049public class Region_Labeling_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
050
051        static LabelingMethod method = LabelingMethod.BreadthFirst;
052        static boolean recolor = false;
053        static boolean listRegions = true;
054        
055    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
056                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES;
057    }
058        
059    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
060        
061                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
062                        IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
063                        return;
064                }
065                
066        if (!getUserInput())
067                return;
068        
069        if (method == LabelingMethod.Recursive && 
070                        !IJ.showMessageWithCancel("Recursive labeling", "This may run out of stack memory!\n" + "Continue?")) {
071                        return;
072        }
073        
074        // Copy the original to a new byte image:
075        ByteProcessor bp = ip.convertToByteProcessor(false);
076                RegionLabeling segmenter = LabelingMethod.getInstance(method, bp);
077
078                // Retrieve the list of detected regions:
079                List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);        // regions are sorted by size
080                if (listRegions) {
081                        IJ.log("Detected regions (sorted by size): " + regions.size());
082                        for (BinaryRegion r: regions) {
083                                IJ.log(r.toString());
084                        }
085                }
086                
087                // Show the resulting labeling as a random color image
088                ImageProcessor labelIp = segmenter.makeLabelImage(recolor);
089                (new ImagePlus("Label Image", labelIp)).show();
090                
091                // Example for processing all regions:
092                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
093                        double mu11 = mu_11(r); // example for calculating region statistics (see below)
094                        IJ.log("Region " + r.getLabel() + ": mu11=" + mu11);
095                }
096    }
097    
098        /**
099         * This method demonstrates how a particular region's central moment
100     * mu_11 could be calculated from the finished region labeling.
101         * @param r a binary region
102         * @return
103         */
104    private double mu_11 (BinaryRegion r) {
105        Point ctr = r.getCenterPoint();
106        final double xc = ctr.getX();   // centroid of this region
107        final double yc = ctr.getY();
108        double mu11 = 0;
109        // iterate through all pixels of regions r:
110        for (Point p : r) {
111                mu11 = mu11 + (p.getX() - xc) * (p.getY() - yc);
112        }
113        return mu11;
114    }
115    
116    private boolean getUserInput() {
117                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(Region_Labeling_Demo.class.getSimpleName());
118                String[] mNames = Enums.getEnumNames(LabelingMethod.class);
119                gd.addChoice("Labeling method", mNames, mNames[0]);
120                gd.addCheckbox("Color result", recolor);
121                gd.addCheckbox("List regions", listRegions);
122                gd.showDialog();
123                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
124                        return false;
125                }
126                method = LabelingMethod.valueOf(gd.getNextChoice());
127                recolor = gd.getNextBoolean();
128                listRegions = gd.getNextBoolean();
129                return true;
130        }
131    
132    
133}
134
135
